Understate: The claim may understate the potential impact of the "9-9-9" plan on poorer Americans by not providing enough information or evidence to support the statement that they will fare better under the plan.
Lack enough support: The claim lacks enough support or evidence to back up the assertion that someone earning $50,000 a year will fare better under the "9-9-9" plan compared to the current tax system.
Problematic assumption: The claim assumes that expanding the tax base under the "9-9-9" plan will result in lower taxes for individuals earning $50,000 a year, without providing sufficient evidence or explanation for this assumption.
Exist alternative explanation: There may be alternative explanations or factors that could affect how someone earning $50,000 a year would fare under the "9-9-9" plan, but these are not addressed or explored in the claim.
